name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: There comes a time in everyone's life when roles are reversed and your kids start taking care of you... I just didn't think it would be this soon! Love you Erica! pic.twitter.com/yjWTQ9KKZZ – at The Pavilion

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Many Americans before us, like those who served in World War II, sacrificed for future generations. Now, it’s our turn to sacrifice for our fellow Vermonters and keep up our social distancing efforts - which are saving many lives. It’s important we don’t let off the gas just yet. pic.twitter.com/aGL0npvcU7 – at The Pavilion

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Later this week, I will announce additional flag protocols to honor all victims of the coronavirus. 

We will get through this, together.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This morning at sunrise, on behalf of all legislators who served with him, and the friends and family who admired him, I lowered the Vermont State Flag to half-staff in memory of former Representative Bernie Juskiewicz. Vermont is strong because of citizen-servants like Bernie. pic.twitter.com/oqQJdKFGf2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I took this picture this morning in my backyard. They blossomed overnight. It reminded me that spring is coming, and there are better days ahead. pic.twitter.com/VoaPhfzUhl

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Although this Easter is unlike any we've experienced, it is still important to reach out and connect with family and friends, even as we must be physically apart. To all Vermonters who are celebrating, Diana and I wish you a happy and healthy Easter. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/PuDVmPbCVp

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
While most of us have been asked to stay home during this crisis, those who work in hospitals and clinics throughout the state are on the front lines, working harder than ever to fight this virus. 

On behalf of all Vermonters, thank you to these health care heroes. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/b5JBVu6tXY

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Today I announced that the deadline for April vehicle inspections has been extended by 60 days. You can also now renew your license online for the first time through @VTDMV. 

You can find more information at the link, below.
 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/vermont-dmv-launches-online-license-renewals … pic.twitter.com/e3oN8812jc

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This terrible virus becomes even more real when it affects someone we know. Wishing you well, Christine. I hope you feel better soon. - Phil https://twitter.com/christine4world/status/1248686576076558336 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Please know, I will work every hour of every day, for as long as it takes, to see Vermont through this and to help rebuild stronger than we were before. 3/3

 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-extends-state-emergency-vermont …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We're making big sacrifices to save lives but we can't let our foot off the gas just yet. We'll continue to watch the trends & once the data shows a downward trend, we can open the spigot, a quarter turn at a time, to get folks back to work in a way that’s responsible & safe. 2/3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today, I’m extending VT's State of Emergency and all corresponding orders and directives until May 15. These are incredibly difficult times, and I know this extension is disappointing news for many. But the fact is, Vermonters are saving hundreds of lives by staying home. 1/3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Earlier this week I visited the @cv_expo in Essex Junction where the @VTNationalGuard has constructed a medical surge site in case hospitals exceed their capacity as a result of COVID-19. I want to once again thank the Guard for their hard work and dedication as Vermont prepares. pic.twitter.com/NnxV4PdDsT

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I'll be joining @SenSanders, @SenatorLeahy and @PeterWelch for a telephone town hall on our efforts to combat COVID-19. You can join us by calling 1-888-480-3635.

I continue to work closely with our congressional delegation to find ways to support Vermonters through this crisis. pic.twitter.com/1ofleeRFPN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Bernie Juskiewicz served his constituents with distinction in the House of Representatives. 

Although this terrible new disease took him from us, the impact of his service will live on. 

I have ordered the Vermont State Flag to fly at half-staff this Monday in his honor. pic.twitter.com/gF38mpRIKL

tweet: We are encouraging other insurers to follow suit.  “Every insurer should begin developing plans to make certain that Vermonters are not overpaying when it comes to their auto insurance.” - @VermontDFR Commissioner @mspieciak (2/2)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:

 https://dfr.vermont.gov/press-release/dfr-approves-allstates-plan-refund-auto-insurance-premiums-during-stay-home-stay-safe …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I’ve written to @POTUS requesting a federal disaster declaration to assist VT in its response to COVID-19. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Educators and parents are working hard to achieve these goals, and this initiative will help support their work. I am grateful to Vermont PBS as this partnership will give those already doing so much another tool to reach and educate students. (3/3)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I recognize there is no replacement for in-person instruction and the learning that takes place in a classroom but this is an unprecedented public health situation, and we must work together to provide the best possible remote learning opportunities for Vermont’s kids. (2/3)

tweet:

You can learn more & sign up at  http://vermont.gov/volunteer  pic.twitter.com/p3SWJl5rS8

tweet: I want to make clear - this is NOT a substitute for staying home & it isn’t an excuse to mingle with others. Please continue to follow the measures we’ve put in place. tweet:

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Our state is at its best when Vermonters pull together to help each other. The coming weeks will be very difficult, but united in common purpose, we will face, fight and defeat this virus – and emerge stronger together. 15/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Support your local Food Bank:
Donate online at  http://vtfoodbank.org  or you can text GIVEHEALTH to 85511. If you're in need of help, click below. 14/15 

  http://vtfoodbank.org/gethelp .

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Give blood: Visit the American Red Cross by clicking below to learn how to safely donate blood. 13/15

 https://www.redcross.org/local/new-hampshire-vermont.html ….

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Donate PPE: Donations of N95 masks, medical and industrial grade or surgical masks can be brought to your nearest State Police Barracks. You can find the location nearest to you by clicking below. 12/15
 https://vsp.vermont.gov/stations .

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermonters can also contribute to blood banks, food banks, and other emergency supply efforts. In addition to volunteering, Vermonters can also give back in the following ways: 11/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We expect to draw upon many skills to meet the challenge of serving those affected by COVID-19, potentially including drivers, food service, construction, IT, security, skilled trades and more. 10/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Other individuals who do not have medical or healthcare backgrounds but are willing to volunteer their time in Vermont’s response effort can register through the state’s volunteer web portal and indicate their expertise and availability. 9/15

 https://www.vermont.gov/volunteer

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: VT has eased licensing requirements for the purposes of aiding this emergency response. Individuals who are licensed in other states or who were previously licensed should visit the Health Dept. website and review the guide on emergency licensure. 8/15 https://www.healthvermont.gov/health-professionals-systems/board-medical-practice/COVID19 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This effort is about drawing more skilled personnel, such as retirees or those not currently employed in the healthcare field, into the response and not about redirecting existing healthcare workers. 7/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The Vermont Medical Reserve Corps is seeking these qualified and experienced volunteers, including: 6/15 pic.twitter.com/yzymXYiLFx

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This is needed because Vermont’s existing health care workers are going above and beyond to respond to this challenge as it unfolds, and they are going to need reinforcements. 5/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The state’s volunteer website directs these individuals to Vermont’s Medical Reserve Corp units, community-based groups of volunteers who can supplement local emergency, health care provider staff and public health resources. 4/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Those with medical experience or other health care backgrounds and the ability to volunteer are needed to bolster the ranks of Vermont’s current health care workforce. 3/15

 https://vermont.gov/volunteer

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we prepare for a surge in COVID-19 cases expected in the coming weeks, it will require each of us to do our part to ease the burden on our health care system, the struggles of those less fortunate, and, ultimately, to save the lives of our friends and neighbors. 2/15

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
THREAD: Today, I’m calling all Vermonters into service with the launch of a new website allowing people to sign up for volunteer assistance to support our response to COVID-19. I’m asking every Vermonter to dig deep and find a way to help. #vtpoli 1/15 

 https://vermont.gov/volunteer .

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I just signed both of these bills into law and once again want to thank the legislature, @VermontSOS and others for their hard work on these measures as part of our response to COVID-19.  https://twitter.com/GovPhilScott/status/1242962348232658944 … pic.twitter.com/YNNZktNroI

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
In light of the significant risk posed by the further spread of COVID-19 I have just signed an Order that requires any person coming from outside the state to Vermont, for anything other than an essential purpose, to home-quarantine for 14 days.
Read more:  http://governor.vermont.gov/addendum7pr

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This morning at 11:00 a.m. I'll be holding another briefing with my team to provide an update on Vermont's ongoing response to COVID-19. You can watch live on most local TV news stations, stream online on their websites, or listen in on the radio on VPR.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Like many in business, trusted news organizations are being hit hard by this pandemic. If you can, please consider subscribing to your local paper or contributing to a VT news organization. You deserve transparency and the truth, and they work hard to keep you informed. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/BC3qhl13fF

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
This is the first weekend since I issued the Stay Home/Stay Safe Order. This, and other mitigation efforts, are all about slowing the spread of COVID-19. We must all stay home as much as possible. Doing so will save lives. 

Here's a reminder from @vemvt on what it means for you. pic.twitter.com/c6tyVHreR3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Earlier today, I wrote to @POTUS asking him to invoke the Defense Production Act to support states get the supplies we need to fight this pandemic. We urgently need more ventilators and other essential equipment, which will require federal assistance. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/h5K0htrCEW

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Today, I directed schools to remain dismissed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. This decision was made in consultation with @healthvermont and @VTEducation
in the continued effort to slow the spread of COVID-19. Read my full statement here:  https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-dismisses-schools-person-instruction-remainder-2019-2020-school … pic.twitter.com/EqTxuwup2D

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The Senate and House have moved quickly to pass the first of what will likely be many measures in response to the COVID-19 public health crisis. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Commercial entities, non-profits, employers and others with questions about acceptable continuation of business operations should contact the Agency of Commerce and Community Development via the online form, below. (2/2)  https://bit.ly/covid-vt-business-operations ….

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
As you know, I issued a Stay Home/Stay Safe Order. Remember, you should leave your home only for essential reasons, and importantly, to get fresh air. But if you do, please follow CDC social distancing guidelines. 
To read the full Order click below. (1/2)  https://governor.vermont.gov/content/addendum-6-executive-order-01-20 … pic.twitter.com/LPTio11Kfh

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
Now is a moment of service for all of us. It’s our turn to face a once-in-a-century challenge.
 
But I know Vermonters are up for it. 

We are #VermontStrong 
 
We will get through this, and we’ll do it, together. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/hR45GEEoAv

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I've just signed a stay-at-home order and directed the closure of in-person operations for all non-essential businesses. 

Vermonters: you must stay home. You must stay home to save lives. 

We are all in this together - and we'll get through it, together.  https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-issues-%E2%80%9Cstay-home-stay-safe%E2%80%9D-order-directs-additional-closures …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you to my friend Rep. @PeterWelch for giving my team an update on Congress's COVID-19 relief package. The American people and our states need Washington's help to get through this, and Vermonters appreciate your hard work. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/nxUGPOk08s

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
We have also extended, among others, personal income tax filing due dates from April 15 to July 15, 2020.
 
This means taxpayers can file and pay these taxes on or before July 15, 2020 without any penalty or interest. Read more below: (2/2) #vtpoli
 https://tax.vermont.gov/press-release/upcoming-vermont-tax-due-date-guidance …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I have directed the Commissioner of Taxes to provide relief to Vermont businesses who owe Meals and Rooms Tax or Sales and Use Tax until further notice.

Many of our local businesses find themselves unable to meet the filing deadlines due to our necessary mitigation steps. (1/2)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I know we’re going to get through this, not because of any one person or any one action, but because of each of us doing our part. We must stand as Vermonters, united. (2/2) pic.twitter.com/VWY05ZK8dO

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This challenge is an opportunity for each of us to step up, even as we must be physically apart. We can unite in our efforts to help those in need. Just like we need to take bold actions to defeat this pandemic, we also need small everyday acts of kindness and goodwill. (1/2) pic.twitter.com/nTcwXJVxOo

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On behalf of all Vermonters, I want to extend my deep appreciation to custodial workers across the state who are working overtime to keep our spaces clean and safe. Thank you for helping us slow the spread of COVID-19. pic.twitter.com/KKVx04fRxA

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont's educators are as critical to our COVID-19 response as anyone. I am incredibly proud of the selflessness of these public servants at this time of need. Thank you for you flexibility, creativity and spirit as Vermonters manage this evolving challenge, together. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/PkeU3wfZHW

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I've also further reduced the allowable size of non-essential gatherings, which are now limited to no more than 10 people at the same time in a single space.

 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-announces-new-covid-19-community-mitigation-measures-directs …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
In consultation with @healthvermont, I'm ordering in-person operations at close-contact businesses, meaning those unable to comply with guidelines for social distancing, to close. Other businesses must work to implement CDC & VDH guidance on COVID-19.

 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-announces-new-covid-19-community-mitigation-measures-directs …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Last night I had the privilege of thanking talented members of the @healthvermont team in Burlington - many working second and third shift -  on behalf of all Vermonters. I was inspired by their sense of duty, commitment to public health and tireless work to keep us safe. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/wEXW1LKDiq

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
(3/3) These loans offer one initial step in helping our small businesses weather this crisis as we continue to measure the impact it will have, and I want to thank the SBA team at our District Office for their support.

To apply online, click here:  https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) I want every Vermonter to know I understand the economic and emotional toll COVID-19 is having on each of us. People are hurting and businesses are at risk. Let me assure you, we will pull every lever and turn every dial we can to support folks through this time.#vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
(1/3) Today, @SBAgov approved my disaster declaration request due to COVID-19. 

Vermont businesses can now apply for Economic Injury Disaster Loans, which offer up to $2 million in assistance, providing help to overcome temporary loss of revenue. #vtpoli
 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-announces-economic-injury-disaster-loans-available-small …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Grocery & food supply workers are critical to our COVID-19 response. To all of you working long & stressful hours, thank you for your hard work. Keeping food & other essentials accessible is critical & your tenacity is appreciated. With your help, we will get through this #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/sAxdAjJGU2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I know all VTers join me in sending our deepest sympathies to the loved ones of the two VTers we sadly lost today. During this difficult time I know some are feeling scared, worried & overwhelmed, but I want you to know we will get through this because we’re all in this together.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I just signed a directive allowing delivery & take-out of alcoholic beverages – including spirit-based drinks – by restaurants, bars & other establishments. If you can, please help them out by ordering take-out or delivery for you & your family! #buylocal  https://governor.vermont.gov/content/directive-4-delivery-and-take-out-beverage-alcohol-department-liquor-and-lottery-pursuant-eo … pic.twitter.com/Dnq3ijgRKd

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you, George! We are all in this together. Thank you for your service to Vermonters during this time of need. #VermontStrong https://twitter.com/VSP_Garry/status/1240261940687052801 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: First, I want to thank heath care workers & our public health officials at @healthvermont for working day and night to keep Vermonters safe and healthy. We owe them a debt of gratitude. We will get through this pandemic, largely thanks to their commitment & sense of duty. #vtpoli pic.twitter.com/bwYCkmKrON

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: THREAD: As we face unprecedented challenges & experience disruptions due to COVID-19, I’ll be highlighting Vermonters for their hard work & the sacrifices they’re making to help us get through these tough times. We will get through this, but it'll take all of us doing our part.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I know there are many disruptions our COVID-19 mitigation steps have caused, but each and every decision we've made is based on science, and will save lives. We must take social distancing seriously. We will get through this. And we'll do it, together. (3/3) #vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I am also in regular contact with our congressional delegation, @SenatorLeahy, @SenSanders and Rep. @PeterWelch, as well as Vermont legislators, to find ways to help Vermonters whose employment has been impacted by our COVID-19 response. (2/3) #vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
During these challenging times I have instructed @VTLabor to launch an online form for unemployment insurance claims and we’re expanding the number of people in our call center to help. 
To file, visit the link below or call 1-877-214-3330 (1/2) #vtpoli
 https://appengine.egov.com/apps/vt/dol/unemploymentinsuranceclaim …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
....so those who are on the front lines of our response can continue to care for the sick, protect the public and manage this evolving challenge. 

I am incredibly proud of the selflessness of these public servants at this time of need. (5/5)  https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-orders-implementation-child-care-system-personnel-essential-covid …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: That’s why, even as we ask the public to step back to help slow the spread of this virus, we are asking others, including our educators and child care providers, to step in and provide a critical service.... (4/5)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Teachers, childcare providers and school support staff are going to be as critical to our response as our doctors, nurses and healthcare support staff. (3/5)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My directive also provides for continuity of funding for schools and providers during the period of school dismissal and closure to help preserve these important services for Vermonters post-response. (2/5) #vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I'm directing childcare centers across the state to close normal operations, but encourage continued operation exclusively where needed to provide services for workers who are essential to Vermont’s ongoing effort in community mitigation of COVID-19. (1/5)
 https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-orders-implementation-child-care-system-personnel-essential-covid …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:
I want Vermonters to know we’re continuously evaluating other mitigation steps and we’ll continue to communicate those as they are put into place. 

We will get through this, but it'll take all of us doing our part. 

For the latest guidance, visit  http://healthvermont.gov/covid19  (2/2)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, effective Tuesday, March 17 at 2:00 p.m. I am ordering the closure of all bars and restaurants statewide. (1/2) #vtpoli  https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-announces-new-guidance-covid-19-community-mitigation-measures …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet:

For guidance on #coronavirus, visit  http://healthvermont.gov . 2/2 pic.twitter.com/4iBTFnryM8

tweet: The orderly dismissal of schools is essential to support both the State’s response to COVID-19 and the needs of children and families across VT. tweet:

tweet: (3/3) For the latest guidance on #coronavirus, visit  http://healthvermont.gov . pic.twitter.com/HWzWfVXlQU

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) Every single one of us has a role to play confronting COVID-19 and protecting those who are most vulnerable to it – the very ill and elderly. We’re all in this together. We’re going to act together, and we’re going to get through this, together. pic.twitter.com/pkqxxFO7Dr

tweet: You can watch my press conference live on television on @WCAX, @WVNYWFFF and @MyNBC5 , as well as online on @VermontPBS at  https://www.vermontpbs.org/live/  https://twitter.com/GovPhilScott/status/1238461415825870849 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today at 5:30 I’ll be joined by public health officials & members of my cabinet to provide an update on VT’s response to COVID-19 & detail new & additional mitigation steps VT is taking to address the spread of the virus. More details on where you can watch live will be provided.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Congratulations to the Caps for winning the CVSA U14 state championship. Good luck in regionals! pic.twitter.com/MtzytYhjBH

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I had the privilege of welcoming a group of inspiring New Americans and refugees in process of obtaining citizenship to my office in the State House. Vermont is proud to welcome refugees and immigrants to our state. pic.twitter.com/dW1pWUIRXD

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I ordered the activation of the State Emergency Operations Center to further support our COVID-19 response. The health operations center has been activated since early February. For the latest guidance on #coronavirus visit  http://healthvermont.gov/covid  pic.twitter.com/7eZUwVzNAB

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Please find additional details from the Vermont Department of Health here: https://www.healthvermont.gov/media/newsroom/vermont-announces-first-presumptive-case-new-coronavirus-covid-19-march-7-2020 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The Vermont Dept. of Health has announced Vermont’s first case of COVID-19. View my statement below: pic.twitter.com/Z612HLont5

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My administration has issued a directive to health insurers so that Vermonters will not be billed for medically necessary COVID-19 testing. And for the latest guidance on #coronavirus, visit  http://healthvermont.gov/covid  https://twitter.com/VermontDFR/status/1235998198998675456 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you, @SenatorLeahy, for your hard work on the appropriations bill that will provide the funding and flexibility we need to respond. I appreciate you, as well as Rep. @PeterWelch, taking the time to update me on Congress’s progress over the past week. https://twitter.com/SenatorLeahy/status/1235616102832467968 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On this day 229 years ago, Vermont was formally admitted to the Union, becoming the 14th state. America is stronger because of the contributions of the Green Mountain State & its people. Stella quarta decima fulgeat (May the fourteenth star shine bright). Happy Birthday, Vermont! pic.twitter.com/vbiCi0x0Pb

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Enjoyed a beautiful afternoon in the 802 cross country skiing @TrappFamily Lodge in Stowe.  Great conditions on the first day of March - in like a lion, out like a lamb! Enjoy the snow while it lasts! #ThinkVT pic.twitter.com/lG4wd6hl4K – at Stowe, VT

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It’s officially @girlscouts Cookie Weekend in VT. Vermonters can stock up on these treats and support the largest entrepreneurship program for girls in the world. See the Girl Scout Weekend proclamation here:  https://bit.ly/2I8XDY5 , and don’t forget to support your local troop! pic.twitter.com/vuTBj1ra8y

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Lucy Terry's ballad, “Bars Fight,” is considered the oldest known work of poetry by an African American. After settling in Guilford, VT, Lucy – a former slave – successfully argued her family's land theft case before the Vermont Supreme Court in 1785. #BlackHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/axdTHSqJtq

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today at 1 p.m., my team at @healthvermont & @vemvt  will provide an update on Coronavirus (COVID-19). While there are currently no cases of people with COVID-19 in Vermont, this team will detail our preparations for, and response to, COVID-19. Watch at:  https://www.facebook.com/vermontemergencymanagement/ …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It was a pleasure to be with Mary again today to sign a proclamation naming Feb. 29 Rare Disease Day in Vermont, raising awareness of the nearly 7,000 @NIH designated rare diseases and conditions that affect Vermonters and Americans. Thank you for you tireless advocacy, Mary!  https://twitter.com/GovPhilScott/status/1222532072104919043 … pic.twitter.com/RYsWtY94RC

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Last year, 69 Vermont senior athletes competed in the National Senior Games in New Mexico. 34 were podium finishers, collectively winning 14 gold, 8 silver and 12 bronze medals. Today I had the honor of welcoming them to the State House and congratulate them for making VT proud. pic.twitter.com/ebAiq2nLqB

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I met with young author, Carter Somaini, a 4th grader from Barre whose book, “The Boy and the Bat,” shows kids with dyslexia that they can do anything they set their mind to. Thanks to Carter and his family for joining me this morning! pic.twitter.com/xaYhLRMoB2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Glad to end our Essex County #VTCapitol4aDay at the Essex House and Tavern in Island Pond. This community is leveraging outdoor recreation to support its economy and showing what a great asset our natural resources and recreation can be. pic.twitter.com/azV97BOI79

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It’s incredibly helpful to hear from those on the ground about the benefits of better integration, helping patients navigate the system and growing the healthcare workforce.  #VTCapitol4aDay

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Community based healthcare helps us deliver vital services in rural areas where access is especially challenging. Pleased to learn more about unique needs & strategies - including coordinated care - in Essex County from the professionals at the Island Pond Health & Dental Center. pic.twitter.com/1GcIBJvKsN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: #VTCapitol4aDay brought us to Sweet Tree Holdings (@themapleguild) in Island Pond. This impressive, innovative operation is producing quality organic syrup, sold around the world. pic.twitter.com/VbfZgUrrU2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: If you’re in the area, make sure to stop by April’s Maple 🍁 pic.twitter.com/1xTitqqaHb

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you to April's Maple for hosting my team & members of @NCChamberofC for a great lunch as part of #VTCapitol4aDay. Great to chat w/ these employers about workforce challenges and economic opportunities, and to learn more about April’s success here in Essex County. pic.twitter.com/FA001Afvsl

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My team is working to strengthen and increase investment in tech centers like this because they are so important to filling critical workforce needs, including nursing, emergency services, manufacturing, agriculture, carpentry, welding and more. #VTCapitol4aDay pic.twitter.com/9Z2VBqMmHK

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The Canaan Career Technical Center offers five college and career pathways to its students, helping train our future workforce and provide greater opportunities for kids from both Vermont and New Hampshire. #VTCapitol4aDay pic.twitter.com/5wtAB3Phy5

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Next stop for #VTCapitol4aDay was to Ethan Allen Sawmill in Beecher Falls. The company provides hundreds of jobs in the Northeast Kingdom, and builds custom furniture sold around the globe. pic.twitter.com/cdnW135zrV

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: .@VTLabor Acting Commissioner Michael Harrington provided details on Essex County’s workforce, which illustrates the two Vermonts that exist and the challenges our rural areas face. #VTCapitol4aDay pic.twitter.com/KalijpBVKq

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Dept. of Forests, Parks & Rec Deputy Commissioner Sam Lincoln shared how last year’s visit to Essex County has helped in our work to support the logging industry, which is critical to the region’s economy. #VTCapitol4aDay pic.twitter.com/AXoYhro10D

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Great to be in Beecher Falls to kick off our Essex County #VTCapitol4aDay! Thanks to Beecher Falls Volunteer Fire Department for hosting our cabinet meeting this morning and for all you do to serve and protect this area. pic.twitter.com/uw1iFfd8Ce

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Don’t forget...Bloomfield,Brunswick, Concord,Ferdinand, Granby,Guildhall,Lunenburg (largest town) and of course Victory (smallest town)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: When I was in the Senate, I was honored to serve with Sen. Julius Canns, who fought for the recognition of Abenaki tribes & advocated for veterans. He was also the first African American to serve in the Vermont Senate. He was a great colleague & public servant. #BlackHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/ecC78K5MSM

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today, I proclaimed it Engineers Week in VT. Engineers play a critical role in our communities, economy & so much of our daily lives - and we need more of them. The good news is there’re many engineering jobs in our state available right now. Learn more @  http://vermontjoblink.com  pic.twitter.com/WIIL8WXCI8

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Born in Corinth, VT, Alexander Twilight was the first African American man to earn a bachelor's degree from an American college. In 1836, he became the first African American man elected to a state legislature, representing Brownington in the VT House of Reps. #BlackHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/6rpFGLSPWn

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thanks to @scoutingvermont for having me at their Eagle Scout Recognition Day to celebrate 27 of the 65 scouts who’ve earned that rank in the last year. Congratulations to these young leaders who do so much to serve others in their communities! pic.twitter.com/2p6TYmPirh

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Eliza Healy (later know as Sister Mary Magdalen) was born into slavery in Georgia and, in 1903, became the first African American mother superior of a Catholic convent when she assumed leadership of the Villa Barlow convent and school in St. Albans, VT. #BlackHistoryMonth

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To learn more about their experiences and important contributions, a good place to start is the Vermont African American Heritage Trail to visit historical sites and hear these stories. #BlackHistoryMonth #ThinkVT  http://bit.ly/37mtChR

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Our shared values as Vermonters have been shaped by those who came before us. The history of African American Vermonters is woven into the story of our state and we honor this legacy as we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: When combined with decreases from 2017-2019, VT employers will pay an average of 30% less in workers’ comp. premiums than before I took office. These savings will help employers of all sizes hire more workers, increase salaries and expand their operations in our state. (2/2) pic.twitter.com/x8vULOL1Xi

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we work to grow the economy, addressing the high cost of doing business in Vermont is critical. This year, I’m happy to announce the largest workers’ compensation insurance rate decrease in decades – without reducing benefits to workers. (1/2) pic.twitter.com/3f77MEJptS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Productive meeting this morning with fellow New England governors @GovNedLamont, @GovJanetMills and @MassGovernor Charlie Baker, discussing clean energy, infrastructure and other ways we can work together as a region. pic.twitter.com/jREDblVQcl

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I’m in D.C. for the @NatlGovsAssoc, working with colleagues to find solutions to issues that face all our states. It’s great to join @MassGovernor, Gov. @DougDucey and others for @GovLarryHogan’s Chair Initiative roundtable on modernizing America’s infrastructure. #WeTheStates pic.twitter.com/ym6CdoYLBI

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday with Loki, and today with Captain America @ChrisEvans to be interviewed for his new project, A Starting Point, which aims to help Americans bridge the gap of political rhetoric and better understand the issues that impact them and their families.  https://twitter.com/GovPhilScott/status/1226179106003390465 … pic.twitter.com/96bJdXyHuV

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Great to meet @VTStatePolice’s newest recruit, Loki, who showed me around the State House yesterday. pic.twitter.com/f1sXoeiqap

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Last week, I vetoed a $29 million payroll tax on VTers & outlined the next steps of my plan to provide a voluntary paid leave program without a tax hike or new bureaucracy. If you agree, contact your reps at 802-828-2228 and ask them to sustain my veto. https://www.facebook.com/1255419051203893/posts/2768860103193106/?vh=e&d=n …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today, I vetoed a new mandatory $29 million payroll tax on working Vermonters, and outlined the next steps of my plan to provide an affordable paid family and medical leave program without a tax increase or new bureaucracy. Read my statement here: #vtpoli  https://governor.vermont.gov/press-release/governor-phil-scott-announces-action-h107-details-progress-towards-voluntary-paid … pic.twitter.com/jIokrGASNN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: #USMCA pic.twitter.com/QY62dUeEkp

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: and I thank Congress for its improvements and action. Our nation needs and deserves much more bipartisanship like this. We must put progress ahead of partisan politics. (2/2)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Ratification of the #USMCA is great news for workers, small businesses, manufacturers, innovators and farmers in Vermont and all across the North American economy. I appreciate the work of President Trump and his administration on this impactful trade deal...(1/2)

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Welcome to @VTStatePolice's newest officer! https://twitter.com/Wej12/status/1222557134849703936 …

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This morning during open door coffee, I had the privilege of meeting Mary Nadon and learning more about Friedreich’s ataxia and her work with @CureFA_org to raise public awareness and find a cure for this debilitating disorder. #CureFA pic.twitter.com/iyb1DP3Gjn

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: A Statement from Governor Phil Scott on Holocaust Remembrance Day:  http://bit.ly/30Yt67U  pic.twitter.com/CuXFiFcOVR

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It was an honor to recognize Vermont World War II veterans today in Stowe. We can never fully repay our debt to members of the Greatest Generation who served. Their bravery, heroism and sacrifice saved the world, and we can never thank them enough. pic.twitter.com/SAnTvjbm5B

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Voting is critical to our democracy and it's important for all Vermonters to participate. Join @VermontSOS and community partners in Burlington and Winooski for New American voting events to learn more about registering to vote and using new translated ballots! pic.twitter.com/iYvAj0orpx

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: If we accept the challenge, set clear objectives, have the discipline to commit to solutions and follow through, we can reverse these trends. We can restore economic vitality to every corner of our state. We can make Vermont more affordable for every family & business. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The issues we face are significant but none greater than the demographic crisis and the economic challenges it brings... Confronting this crisis now is the only way to preserve our ability to solve problems in the future. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My $3.15M Clean Grid Modernization Package will encourage companies to start & expand here by making R&D work eligible for a tax credit and will provide $2M in capital & technical assistance... and I propose we eliminate the corporate income tax on these job creators. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) While we wait for Congress to work on a national solution, electric utilities have introduced EV-specific rates and will recommend a pilot program for the collection of revenue from EV charging stations to support long-term transportation maintenance. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) My budget proposes to invest $3 million to address [obstacles to EV purchases] and help meet our climate & energy goals... We’ll increase funding for incentives, consumer education and support services and… more charging stations on our highways & our workplaces. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On top of everything we’re already doing & everything I’m proposing... I propose committing 25% of all future end-of-year budget surpluses for additional investments that address climate change, specifically for initiatives that support weatherization or electrification.#VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To create an incentive for military vets to return to VT & join our workforce, I’m again proposing to exempt military retirement pay from the income tax... I hope you’ll join me this year in eliminating the tax on those who devoted their lives in service to our nation. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (4/4) That America is still a land of opportunity for all who seek freedom from oppression, security for their families or, in some cases, just a fresh start. As long as I’m governor, they’ll be welcome right here in Vermont. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/4) These efforts not only benefit our state, they also signal we’re committed to the values this nation was built on. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/4) This includes funding to @VTLabor that will help communities plan for and explore refugee resettlement and opportunities to welcome more New Americans to Vermont. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/4) We’ll continue to advocate for more legal immigration as a way to bring more hardworking people to Vermont to contribute to our economy and grow our workforce. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’ll also continue our efforts to recruit more people to live and work here. This includes increased funding for @VTLabor's VT Relocation Assistance Program to ensure folks interested in moving here have the info they need about jobs, housing & opportunities available. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We hear about our growing labor shortage in every sector on a daily basis... I ask you to work with me on a $1M incentive to keep graduates from our registered nurse and licensed practical nurse programs right here... filling positions desperately needed by employers. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) If you’re willing to look at things differently and move with urgency, we can have a unified, statewide training program next year. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) I’ve also asked @VTLabor and @VTEducation to work with @VSC_edu to align our Adult Ed and Adult CTE system with @CCV_VT, @vttech, our tech centers and regional stakeholders. This will create a seamless pathway from school to training to work. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/3) That’s why I’ve directed @VTLabor to work with @VSC_edu and tech centers throughout the state to double the number of apprentices by 2023. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) Apprenticeships are great opportunities for Vermonters to earn while they learn... These programs are industry-driven, allowing employers to recruit for good jobs they have available. But there’s an opportunity and need to do more. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) Over the last four years, we’ve added more than 700 apprentices to our workforce, which includes a 36% increase in the number of women in these important programs. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) Let’s build on this success with an additional $3 million for childcare assistance, and let’s also expand the lottery and commit these new revenues to this initiative each year moving forward. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) We know the benefits of accessible, affordable childcare for parents, kids and our economy, which is why we’ve worked together to increase funding by 30%—about $10 million—over the last three years, and these investments are working. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To recognize the incredible importance of our larger anchor employers... I propose a $3M VT Capital Investment Incentive Program which encourages these companies to make new upgrades at local facilities & in exchange... they’ll commit to maintain certain payroll levels. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To support more small business growth, I’m proposing a $1 million incentive program through the Vermont Economic Development Authority (VEDA) to provide low-cost loans that convert to no-cost grants after meeting expansion and payroll goals. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) And when they’re successful, we’ll provide a match to the federal grant to help them grow and create jobs. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) We’ll also support our small technology businesses with an investment of $1M to help them secure federal Small Business Innovation grants for groundbreaking work done right here in Vermont and to tap into the research capabilities at our colleges and universities. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Let’s make it easier to start, register and operate a business here. Working with @VermontSOS, my budget includes $1 million for a streamlined and online business portal which will make it much easier for them to navigate state government. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As another part of my Community Investment Package, my budget includes $1M for incentives to rehabilitate old homes into decent, affordable, energy efficient rental properties [and] reforms to the Renter Rebate Program... resulting in about $800K more in rebates. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) Let’s couple the most beautiful state in the nation with an increased investment to remind the 70 million people who live within a six-hour drive that we’re not only a great place to visit but also to live, work, play and, hopefully, invest in. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) Tourism is a top contributor to our economy. But we’re investing far less than every other state in the region & we compete with them for visitors every single day. My budget includes an additional $1M investment in tourism, economic dev & outdoor rec marketing. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To further strengthen Vermont’s small towns, agriculture and other businesses, I’ve budgeted $750,000 for the Working Lands initiative which will help expand production of quality food, forest products and jobs. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I also propose a $2.8M investment that will leverage another $11.3M in federal funds to complete the Lamoille Valley Rail Trail.... When complete, the activity it will create—along with cross promotion—will strengthen businesses, economies & the quality of life. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The City of Newport is now poised for a once-in-a-generation redevelopment... The capital bill now includes $1.5M to begin the process of helping to revitalize Main St... bring[ing] public & private investment together to implement a larger vision for Newport & the NEK. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Tax Increment Financing [districts] not only create economic growth but also empower communities to shape their own future... I’ll continue to support expanding them across Vermont, including a proposal to make them available to smaller communities. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today, I propose increasing the downtown & village center tax credits to $4 million—a $1.4 million increase. These dollars support important projects like Springfield’s Woolson Block & Bennington’s Putnam Block that are often the first step in community revitalization. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: To put all Vermonters on a better path, we must increase economic opportunity in each of our 14 counties. That’s why this budget includes more investments in downtowns and regional economic centers, and tools to help employers survive and create more good paying jobs. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’re one of only 4 states moving forward with a prescription importation program… Our estimates show this could save millions… My budget includes resources to continue this important effort, because lowering the costs of prescription drugs is the right thing to do. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) I recommend we continue to support this work by asking you to authorize the $5.7M for delivery system reforms proposed in budget adjustment on the condition the ACO operate as a non-profit or meet those same transparency standards. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) In 2018, the providers the state paid through the ACO reduced the amount of money spent on healthcare services by $7.7M. In the same year, providers who were not paid through the ACO spent $1.5M more than expected. Early results for 2019 show a similar pattern. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’ll be able to triple the number of barracks where we embed [social workers], which will reduce the volume of emergency calls, hospitalizations and court involvement for some of our most vulnerable Vermonters, all within existing resources. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I’d like to pilot a new mental health Mobile Response Unit. In other states, this model has reduced emergency room visits and hospital admissions, saved many hours of law enforcement time and helped foster kids find stability. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Tragically, suicide is a growing risk around the country, and we know all too well Vermont is not immune. Our approach must focus on early intervention for those at risk. That’s why my budget invests over $1 million more in suicide prevention & mental health services. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/3) Coupled with the universal afterschool network I proposed in the State of the State and expanding mental health services in schools, we can prevent serious problems before they develop and give every child the hope and opportunity they need and deserve. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) ...reduced costs of child protection, special education, substance abuse and criminal justice services down the road and put families on a path to economic self-sufficiency. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) By investing $1M more in our newborn home visiting program, we can cover roughly 1/4 of all the babies born each year, giving these parents the support they need to build a better foundation for their kids. This model has improved the health of babies and moms... #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My budget prioritizes spending to prevent root causes rather than just treat consequences... to find efficiencies, make structural changes & create savings in order to reinvest in areas that prevent problems in the first place which will further reduce costs over time. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Our demographic crisis is without question the greatest challenge we face as a state... But here’s the thing: We can fix it, so long as we resist the temptation to ignore it, get distracted by politics or become deterred by hard work. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) And even with consistent revenue growth, each year we’ve had to make difficult decisions with reductions to agencies, departments, programs and services. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) The General Fund budget I’m presenting spends $1.7 billion, which is an increase of 2.8% or $46 million over the current year. Here’s the frustrating part: Even with organic revenue growth, we still started building our General Fund budget with a $70 million gap. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) ...student performance and the number of kids continue to decrease. Since Act 60 was passed, we’ve lost 26,000 students from our K-12 public schools while education spending has more than doubled. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) In the Education Fund... we project spending to total over $1.8 billion, an $87 million, 5% increase over the current year. Unfortunately, we’re seeing spending, property taxes, as well as inequity, continue to increase while educational opportunities... #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’re now in the second year of the $124 million capital bill. I’ll propose a few changes... but we remain on target in most areas. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) This includes $100M for roads and paving, major projects like the new draw bridge in Grand Isle & our rail project in Middlebury... It provides for 158 new park and ride spaces, investments in bike and ped projects and so much more. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) The transportation budget includes $276.7M in state funds... leveraging another $335.6M in federal funds. This amounts to a $25.5M increase... the largest transportation budget since the Irene recovery, without raising additional taxes or fees. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This is the approach we took, and in the upcoming fiscal year, across all funds, our budget totals $6.3 billion. With $4.2 billion of state revenue sources and $2.1 billion in federal dollars, this is an increase of about 2% over the current year. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: With each budget proposal, I’ve focused on our fiscal fundamentals, to balance what we want with what we need and to set us on a path where our capacity to solve problems and help people grows while the burden on taxpayers shrinks. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It’s my belief the state budget should not grow any faster than people’s paychecks. Our goal should be to do our work in ways that help Vermonters keep more of what they earn, making it easier—not harder—for every family to live a secure and stable life. #VTBudget

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My team will be live tweeting my FY21 Budget Address this afternoon. Follow along with #VTBudget and on my Facebook live stream:  http://bit.ly/2Rclc7L

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: pic.twitter.com/QRAqvxJ4x1

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My proclamation for Martin Luther King, Jr. Appreciation Day tomorrow, January 20: pic.twitter.com/rRn9HaWtvN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Dr. King continues to inspire us. His dream remains in progress, but his life shows we can all help shape our future, transform our nation and set an example for our kids. Let’s recommit to his vision, working toward something bigger than ourselves. #MLK pic.twitter.com/wqUHiKdR8U

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we begin this holiday weekend in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., let’s draw inspiration from his example and his words: “Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” #MLK pic.twitter.com/cJUoUYdPfZ

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: If we focus on the fundamentals: a better, more modern government, a stronger fiscal foundation and policy that’s truly equitable, then our communities will be stronger and more resilient than ever before. #VTSOTS pic.twitter.com/yOWVPMBENu

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I also recognized the Ludlow Fire Dept, who went above & beyond the call of duty on Thanksgiving when a family's stove caught fire, destroying their turkey. Firefighters extinguished the flame & went back to the firehouse to cook the family's dinner, saving their holiday. #VTSOTS pic.twitter.com/2dP569kyFK

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The work Vermont’s fire fighters do every day is an inspiration for us all. Not only do they save lives, but livelihoods, homes, property & so much more. It was great to join so many farmiliar faces at the Addison County Fire Fighters Association dinner tonight for my 10th year. pic.twitter.com/n5vGQKb9VI

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The fact is, where we are as a state and where we go from here is in the hands of every Vermonter. #VTSOTS pic.twitter.com/j1mxbJa6s0

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: In my #VTSOTS I also highlighted Gloria Powers. Gloria has provided a home for nearly 400 foster children over 25 yrs. She spends hours each week at the Glover Senior Center, providing meals for members of her community. She wakes up every day wondering how she can help others. pic.twitter.com/CuIeKmI98I

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermonters of the Greatest Generation who served during WWII, like my dad, stepped up to protect democracy for their generation and those of us who followed. Thank you to the vets of the Barre American Legion Post and the POWs who attended my #VTSOTS – and to all who served. pic.twitter.com/AYWwlz9Rdt

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Where we are as a state, and where we go from here, is in the hands of every Vermonter. It’s the people of Vermont, doing all they can to lift each other up, who will shape our future. They define who we are and all we can be. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I wouldn’t want to get ahead of my Budget Address, John

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Duchess Meghan and Prince Harry, what about checking out a smaller Kingdom.... Vermont’s Northeast Kingdom! It’s a great place to live, work and play. And it’s even close to Canada! #ThinkVermont  https://twitter.com/BBCBreaking/status/1214981388216291330 … pic.twitter.com/J8OtFm3HLK

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: If our sense of service and duty is strong; if our commitment to our neighbors is unwavering; and if we remember that we are all part of something bigger than ourselves, then the state of the state, our future and our people will be stronger than ever before. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: When [difficult] moments come, I think of the people who inspire me to be part of something bigger, of what they’ve endured with courage and resolve, and how they show that in the face of incredible adversity, we’re all capable of great things. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Over the next few months, the way we go about our work will not only determine the results we’re able to deliver but also the strength of our institutions, the faith Vermonters have in us and the example we set for our kids. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I’ll also propose a package of criminal justice reforms that we’ve shared with the comms. of jurisdiction… As we continue to create a more effective criminal justice system, we must remember that justice for victims & accountability for criminals must be top priorities. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Many of you, alongside the Agency of Human Services, have worked diligently to improve our mental health system. This includes adding inpatient capacity, which is critical to getting people the care they need, when they need it. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We took significant steps over the last year to protect kids: passing legislation to address the vaping epidemic and to ensure drinking water at every school and child care center will be tested for lead. And this work will continue. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/3) ...as well as expanding our battery and renewable energy storage sectors and the jobs they can create. And I’ll propose giving small co-ops and municipal utilities more flexibility in order to innovate. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) As we look even further ahead, I strongly believe it’s incentives, not penalties, which will help us transition more quickly... My budget will propose more incentives and a greater focus on affordable, clean energy... #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) We know about half of the emissions that contribute to climate change come from transportation. That’s why we’ve also worked together to make it more affordable to purchase electric vehicles. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) And, when paired with my proposed investments in housing & economic development, will support more vibrant, walkable & livable downtowns & villages which, as the Speaker has said, supports economic growth & is a critical piece of our work to combat climate change. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) I also appreciate the sense of urgency Speaker Johnson and others have placed on modernizing Act 250… The balanced approach we’re working on would enable concentrated development where people want to live & work. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Because of the economic imbalance from region to region, I still hear about the difficulty of finding an affordable place to live. That’s why my budget will include a package to revitalize existing homes and build more of them, targeted to the places that need it most. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I propose to you today that we begin creating a universal afterschool network that ensures every child has access to enrichment opportunities outside of current classroom time, and to align the students’ day with the length of the workday. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) Because, ultimately, we need to help people in all parts of the state move up the economic ladder, and the best way to do this is to level the economic playing field and make Vermont more affordable for all families and every business. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) Overall tax and fee burden is still growing far too fast, especially property taxes, and you can expect additional targeted tax relief in my budget. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/3) …my budget will include additional investments in training, with an emphasis on the trades and more incentives for young adults and working-age families to stay or move here. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) And we're helping those in recovery or with other barriers to employment find and keep good jobs... In partnership with @VermontSOS let’s further reduce hurdles and costs for licensed professionals so we can bring more of them into the workforce. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) We’re strengthening training, internship & apprenticeship programs for VTers. We established a first-in-the-nation approach to make it easy for veterans to transition to civilian careers. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) We know this isn’t the only answer, but this program is a small step towards growing our way out of the demographic crisis facing our state and the affordability crisis facing our families. #VTSOTS @VTEconDev

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) Since [the launch of the remote worker incentive], we’ve received worldwide attention, more than $7 million in free advertising, thousands of inquiries and relocated 371 people to more than 68 communities across 13 counties. #VTSOTS @VTEconDev

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (3/3) ...then our businesses and economy will grow, putting more kids in our schools and broadening our tax base, making our communities stronger and more resilient than ever before. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) ...if we focus on the fundamentals: a better, more modern government, a stronger fiscal foundation and policy that’s truly equitable... #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) If we’re willing to focus on doing the work, on caring more about the details than we do the talking points; if we can build consensus and trust and avoid national political agendas deliberately designed to divide us... #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Sustainable, economic growth has become too hard & too rare in too many areas. It’s hurting people. It’s regressive. It’s creating regional inequity. And it’s by far the biggest & most immediate challenge to our state & the ability of government to help shape the future. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This is what a demographic crisis looks like. In too many places, and in the lives of too many Vermonters, I see and feel the emotional and financial toll of policies built for a few areas in the state that can afford them when the rest of the state cannot. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: From county to county, there’s a huge gap between median home values, median household income, average wage & so much more... across the state, we’re feeling the negative impacts in everything from our homes, schools & colleges to our hospitals & nursing homes. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Of the five towns that have seen the most growth in recent years, four of them are in Chittenden County. And in the past 12 years, only three counties have added workers. The other 11 have lost a total of about 18,000. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today in Vermont, there are about 55,000 fewer people under the age of 45 and 44,000 more over the age of 65 than there were in the year 2000. For years, we had more deaths than births, and have seen more people move out of Vermont than in. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/2) So, even as we face major challenges, these Vermonters show that in the hands of our people, doing all they can every day, the state of the state is strong. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/2) These people and thousands more—those we hear about and those we don’t—remind us that we are all part of something bigger, and that it’s in our pursuit of purpose and in service to others that we find the best of ourselves, our communities, our state and our nation. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The state of the state, our values and identity are guided by—but have never been defined by—what happens in this building. It’s the people of Vermont, doing all they can to lift each other up, who will shape our future. They define who we are and all we can be. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: While good things are happening and progress is being made, too many of our counties, communities and families remain at a critical crossroad. The fact is, where we are as a state, and where we go from here, is in the hands of every Vermonter. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This, my fellow Vermonters, is how we rise above partisanship, how we reject polarization, how we work toward something bigger than ourselves and how we—all of us in this room—can best lead our nation forward. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: In state houses and town halls across America, it’s up to us to show that people from different backgrounds, with different points of view, can unite around our core values and our common humanity. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As elected officials, it’s our duty to distinguish what must be done from what we might like to do, and to work together, pulling in the same direction, to make a difference for those we serve. #VTSOTS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My team will be live tweeting my State of the State address this afternoon. Follow along with #VTSOTS and on my Facebook live stream:  http://bit.ly/2QUli2z

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It’s not the start of the legislative session until Senator Mazza delivers coffee. pic.twitter.com/6oypfiyz1b

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you to @TimesArgus for reminding us of all the ways (big and small) we can be better neighbors and role models as we enter the New Year. http://bit.ly/35k0dUe

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Happy New Year, Vermont! pic.twitter.com/VXNUnBMRH0
